channel.title: Age of Ravens: History of Licensed RPGs (Pt V 1993-95)
channel.description:
![licensed%20banner%20copy|690x231](upload://b2BobaaVNULfXDPUBy5c8ANGHuh.jpeg) I have the latest installment of my lists exploring games based on existing properties...and it's a doozy.
**[Age of Ravens: History of Licensed RPGs (Pt V 1993-95)](https://www.gauntlet-rpg.com/blog/age-of-ravens-history-of-licensed-rpgs-part-v-1993-95)**
This list includes several non-US releases, though I suspect there's more to be found for these years. It has several truly bizarre entries based on films. It also contains multiple releases from three of the biggest "licensed" engines: GURPS, Masterbook, and Japan's MAGIUS. The list has some gems: *Project A-Ko*, *Street Fighter the Storytelling Game*, and *Tank Girl* for example. But it also has *Superbabes*, the *Femforce* RPG :unamused:.
[One link I have to go back and add is this story from VICE on Street Fighter's RPG.](https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/gyjjy3/the-story-behind-the-street-fighter-rpg-you-never-heard-of)

item.title: Age of Ravens: History of Licensed RPGs (Pt V 1993-95)
